intro: Zephyranthes saipinensis, commonly known as the pink rain lily, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking pink or purple flowers that bloom in response to rainfall, often during the rainy season. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, or areas with high humidity, showcasing its adaptation to moist environments. Its bulbs are underground, allowing it to survive dry periods by storing water and nutrients. Zephyranthes saipinensis is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes other bulbous plants with showy flowers.
